original: JOHNSON, Ernst Torsten, Diplomingenjör, Stockholm, f Borås 29/9 03 av appretören E W J o Anna Maria Anderson, gm Iris Hartman. Studex v Sv Klassiska Lyceum i Åbo 22, Åbo Akademi 22—28, dipl där 28. Forskn-o undervisn.ass v Åbo Akademis inst i träkemi 26—30, l:e ass å KTH:s inst f cellulosa-tekn 30, nu l :e ing v Cellulosaind:s Central-lab, Sthlm.
translated: JOHNSON, Ernst Torsten, Diplom Engineer, Stockholm, born in Borås on September 29, 1903, to the finisher E.W.J. and Anna Maria Anderson. Married to Iris Hartman. Studied at the Finnish Classical Lyceum in Åbo from 1922, Åbo Academy from 1922-1928, obtained a diploma there in 1928. Research and teaching assistant at Åbo Academy's Institute of Wood Chemistry from 1926-1930, first assistant at KTH's Institute of Cellulose Technology in 1930, currently working as a first engineer at the Central Laboratory of the Cellulose Industry in Stockholm.
